sub_title: Technologist (Dynamics/Mechanics/FEM) at Philips, Data Science Enthusiast
summary:
I work as a Technologist Dynamics & FEM at Philips Engineering Solutions. Previously worked as a Project Engineer in the analysis and measurement group within Mecal Semiconductor Product Development BV at Eindhoven, The Netherlands. I graduated from TU Delft as a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering with the specialization of Precision and Microsystems engineering. 

My key areas of interests are mechanics, dynamics and optimization; be it an automotive system, a high-tech system, a micro-nano device or for any other business including mechanical system/ component analysis. I can also work as a project engineer and a product analyst.  Recently I have also started working with data science/analysis. I plan to adopt mechanical analysis techniques to incorporate the benefits of data science field. 

I continuously thrive to contribute to society by applying my knowledge in research, sustainable development and innovative concepts. Drive for the continuous improvement of myself and taking risks is always allowing me to look forward and implement my knowledge for the betterment of the society I live in.

awards.title: Honors Programme Masters in Mechanical Engineering
awards.description: Honors Programme is an additional programme that is offered to TU Delft's students. This programme allowed me to work on several projects and develop my academic skills in practical aspects.

projects.title: Load Estimation and Uncertainty Analysis based on Strain Measurement for application to the Load Sensing Bearing
projects.description:
[MATLAB]

The concept of Load Sensing Bearing (LSB) is not new and is being researched since early 1970s. When the load acting on a bearing is estimated with help of the measured deformation of a bearing, it is called the load sensing bearing. The concept is useful for many applications, but till date accurate estimation of load acting on the bearing is not avaialble. Task of my work was to include the information about the mechanics and the first principles of mechanics in the estimation algorithm.

contributors.headline: Technologist (Dynamics/Mechanics/FEM) at Philips, Data Science Enthusiast

projects.title: Design Optimization of MEMS based heater for TEM (Transmission Electron Microscope) application
projects.description:
[COMSOL Multiphysics, SolidWorks, Livelink between COMSOL and SolidWorks]

Currently using TEM only static images of the samples can be taken. It desirable by industries to observe the transient behavior of the sample under heat application. For the same industry had developed MEMS based heater to eliminate the thermal drift. The main problem with the current design of heater is that it bulges at higher temperature. In this project I am optimizing the design, using COMSOL, of the heater so as to get the same heat generation with the reduced and/or eliminated bulging. 

For this project I got a grade of 8/10.

contributors.headline: Technologist (Dynamics/Mechanics/FEM) at Philips, Data Science Enthusiast

projects.title: StreetLight Evolution
projects.description:
[SolidWorks, Ansys]

Streetlight Evolution is all about attention. Attention for the beauty of everyday items that usually go unnoticed, such as street lights. Attention for their history. Attention for the engineers behind them. The street lights are placed in a bouquet formation, which makes the lightposts put each other in the spotlight. This invites the spectator to look at the light posts, instead of merely their gleam. The artwork will be interactive to keep the spectator's attention even longer

Street Light Evolution is a collaboration between ten Honours Students from the Delft University of Technology, led by Koen Fraijman. The students are realising this project in three months, besides their regular curriculum.

projects.title: Analysis of a Wooden Roller Coaster
projects.description:
[MATLAB]

As a part of a subject "Numerical Methods for Dynamics", an analysis of a wooden roller-coaster was done using MATLAB. In this project the structure was evaluated, both, statically and dynamically. In dynamic condition the analysis was done to incorporate the effects of passing cart, external wind and the possible earthquake.

For analysis, different numerical methods were employed. For finding eigenvalues, eigensolvers like - orthogonal deflation, Lanczos method were used and to include dynamic effects time integration was done using newmark scheme, modal superposition, modal accelaration and base excitation. Results of each method were compared and discussed. 

Further sensitivity analyses of eigenmodes and eigenfrequencies were done. At last it was analyzed that whether the generated code can be deployed in parallel to reduce the computational time or not. 

For the subject (50% Project + 50% oral exam) I got a grade of 9.5/10.

projects.title: BAJA SAEINDIA, 2012

[Pro-Engineering, Ansys, Experiments]

BAJA SAEINDIA is the competition for designing, fabricating and competing All Terrain Vehicle, held at India every year.  For the year 2012, team from Nirma University; called Team Stallions; won award for best technological innovation and stood 10th in overall ranking.

projects.title: BAJA SAEINDIA 2011 (Team Stallions)
projects.description:
[Pro-Engineering, Ansys, Experiments]

SAEIndia BAJA 2011, is the event we as a team participated in, for the first time. The year 2011, was the first year of participation for Team Stallions. The aim of the event was to design, present and manufacture an All Terrain Vehicle (ATV) that can survive a rocky terrain for 3 hours of endurance run, after qualifying through Brake, Acceleration, Steering, and Oil Spill Tests. In the preliminary rounds, around 200 teams participated, of which around 80 were allowed to go forward and fabricate the vehicle. Our vehicle finished overall 19th nationally in its maiden attempt. In the subsequent years of participation, after the strong foundation laid in the first year, the team had one many awards such as Best Innovation, Go-Green and Highest Acceleration awards.

profile_positions.description:
At MECAL, I worked as a Project Engineer (multi-physics FEM analyst). My main task is to analyze various mechanical/thermal  components and systems for customers and product development group within MECAL. 

My responsibilities include:
- Understand customer requirements to analyze their design
- Execute the analyses, while keeping customers in loop. 
- Report results and advise customers and project team on improving the functional requirements of the component and its interaction at system level.
- Develop competencies within MECAL

Additionally I have also taken up the task of Internal Auditing for ISO 9001:2018 (quality), ISO 14001:2018 (environment) and ISO 45001:2018 (health and safety) at MECAL.
profile_positions.title: Project Engineer (Dynamics/Mechanics/Thermal Analysis/ FEM Expert)

profile_positions.description:
[MATLAB, Topology Optimization, CATIA, Experiments]

Nuon Solar Team designs and builds the car every two years for the World Solar Challenge being held at Australia. Last year they decided to even participate in Sasol Solar Challenge at South Africa. As a mechanical engineer my responsibilities were to make the car stable and compatible for the terrain of South Africa. Mainly, I analysed the causes of instability and solved the issue by changing the design of the link joining suspension and steering.
profile_positions.title: Mechanics

profile_positions.description:
I joined General Motors India Private Limited as a Graduate Engineer Trainee. In one year I got a training through various department of the plant, including assembly shop, quality control, engineering solutions, supply chain and purchase. 
Later, I was assigned a job of purchasing interior commodities of the car. Key responsibility I handled was to transfer the supplier business for the purpose of quality control.
